data.title: My Bar
data.text: Since I moved back to Florida, the SkyBar has been my "go to" bar the last 2 years. Perched atop the Firestone Grill Complex which includes the Martini Bar, the SkyBar offers the best riverfront view available in the area. I prefer the late afternoon hours where I can appreciate the unique view, the sunset and the natural ambiance of good friends, good food and well prepared drinks. Be advised I'm prejudiced. I've come to know the staff well as they have always taken good care of me. The happy hour specials are well thought out in both the drink and appetizer venues. The servers and bar staff provide each customer with the thought that they are there only to provide for them. Later in the evening the crowd changes. One can experience a touch of South Beach until the wee weekend hours. Bottle tables and service are usually available. Music by recognized DJs appear to be appreciated by the wall to wall crowd. A crowd that is well behaved as security provided by the management keeps a lid on the party. I've never had a bad experience other than the time they ran out of Grey Goose. Many locals never try the SkyBar as they believe it to be a tourist trap affair. How wrong they are. It's a Gem on the Riverfront. A consistently well run operation.

data.title: Awesome views
data.text: Come here every time we are in fort Myers, stunning views, excellent layout, friendly staff.  If your in the area stop by you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Sky Bar
data.text: One of the funnest places in sw Florida, can't wait to go back in October, I fell in love with the blond bartender, was a great worker and was allways smiling!

data.title: Best bar in Fort Myers
data.text: Always go here in the evening to watch the sunset.  Best bar server ever Sierra!  Good good available from Firewood Grill downstairs and martini bar open on weekends.  Must visit in Fort Myers downtown area.

data.title: Fantastic view, great drinks
data.text: Skybar sits atop the Firestone Grill and is accessed by elevator only. We got there during the week when the lounge area was not reserved for bottle only patrons. We started at the bar but moved to the lounge area for better view of the entire area. Drink prices are awesome during their happy hour and staff was very friendly.  Couldn't stay for the sunset or music as we had reservations for the Firestone below.

data.title: Nice view
data.text: Great view! Very busy. Not much room to move on a Friday night. Good drinks. Fair priced. Take an elevator to get to the top. There was live music. Only downfall was, we wanted to go back but they were closed Sunday and Monday night.

data.title: Great views and sweet drink specials
data.text: We were meeting friends on vacation in FL and Ft Myers happened to be the halfway spot so I chose Skybar having been once before. It was just as fun the second time around, the views are great, it wasn't horribly crowded but had a decent swell of energy about the place. People just hanging out having a good time. The drink specials were surprisingly good, $5 top shelf = fun times! If you go to Ft. Myers and are downtown, you'll definitely want to check this place out especially for the views.

data.title: Best view in town.
data.text: Great place to have a cocktail before dark.  Though they make good drinks and have a nice bar food menu during happy hour the view is a big part of the attraction.

data.title: I wouldn't even give this place a one star!!!!! Horrible
data.text: The WHOLE staff was rude!! We were there for a birthday party and started at the martini bar and put our name in for the sky bar. We got told we were aloud up and all the sudden the bouncer said only 4 are aloud up right now!!! There was an other 4 people left in the martini bar! I told the bouncer we don't want to go up unless we are all together ( I wasn't going to leave the person we came to celebrate her birthday down here ) he then told me we couldn't come back down! The four of us NOW had to go to the sky bar and wait for then!! So we went and the other group NEVER was able to get up there!!! SO DUMB !! So the group of us at the sky bar left and just met the other group outside where they left the martini bar also! I WILL NEVER BE BACK!!! I have lived in fort Myers my whole life and this place is not something I or anyone of my friends will be back!!! The drinks are expensive and the bouncer / bartenders are rude! I felt very disrespected !!!!!!!

data.title: Grett drinks and appetizers!
data.text: Love the view!!!! Great appetizers, service is good and the drinks are cold. Great prices for Happy Hour! Always busy!

data.title: terrible service...ignored the whole time
data.text: we waited a very long time to be served and had to go to the bar.  Even then people around us were served INSTEAD of us.  No matter what the reason for this, it is unacceptable.  We live on Ft Myers Beach and decided to enjoy a night downtown bar hopping.  This was one of our first stops

data.title: Sunset and Cocktails
data.text: You will want to capture a view from the top of the Firestone Restaurant in their SKYBAR. Open air, lively atmosphere, food served at the bar our at the comfy sofa seating areas.  Often live music after hte sun goes down.  Drinks aren't cheap but they make an effort to accommodate your needs.  I was pleasantly surprised with the tasty tuna tar tar with won tons and sea weed salad and beef skewers as our shared appetizers which were adequate for dinner.  Its a well known spot with folks who live or regularly vacation here and its "all about the sunset" over the Caloosahatchie River. View all the bridges leading to Cape Coral and enjoy the night sky.  You will take the elevator to the top.  If you decide to do dinner or lunch at the Firestone, (ground floor or level 2) the food is always good and the decor is really fun, too.  (note the Firestone tires moving on conveyor belts along the walls and the open "mill" atmosphere.)  If you Valet park your car, across the street, the Firestone will validate your ticket, so parking is free.

data.title: Shannon visits Fort Myers
data.text: Fun place. This bar has an awesome view, nice for sipping a cocktail. DJ's we're great! Played requested music and what the crowd liked. A unique adult hangout for an awesome night of dancing and drinks!

data.title: Must see
data.text: Great cocktails and great sunset! Very friendly staff. A great place when you come to take in the scenery while enjoying your friends and families presence.

data.title: Great View from this Rooftop Bar
data.text: We arrived a little after 4pm (opening time) and took the elevator to the rooftop. All the seats were already taken so get there early, the view is really nice overlooking the river. We didn't stay but will arrive ahead of opening next time. Great place to lounge and have a drink. Don't forget to spend some time at the water side park just in front of the building. There is also a restaurant on the 1st and 2nd floors.

data.title: Don't Miss Out on the Sunsets!
data.text: Great place to meet people, sip a few drinks and soak up the atmosphere! On a fantastic sunny afternoon, our bartender took good care of us. Though busy, read packed, we still got seats and enjoyed the "buzz". Good martinis & other cocktails on offer.

data.title: Adult Fun on the Roof
data.text: Great music and dancing in an open air club. Large screen T.V.'s around the bar on top of the building with great view.

data.title: Cool spot with a water view.
data.text:
We stopped by the Skybar before dinner.  It was a chilly evening with some wind coming in off of the water, but their heaters were on, the company was good, and the staff was friendly.

Nice spot for a cocktail.

data.title: good drinks,
data.text: We recently stopped in at the Sky Bar to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. The view is great and the service was too. I didn't like one of the cocktails so the waitress swapped it for one I liked better. Nice place!

data.title: Stay downstairs in Martini Bar
data.text:
Was abit disappointed with the sky bar-don't like that people can smoke up there and there was no dancefloor.

The Martini Bar downstairs though was very good-staff friendly and the DJ was great-played some amazing mixes.
